content: to twist the chain chain 200 approx 24 or to desired length the stitch count is not important except that it should be the same for both handles you will need to stitch into these chs in r2 so chain loosely or use a larger hook bordering other side of 1st top portion single_crochet into the first double_crochet on the opposite side of the same top section counting the single_crochet just worked as the first single_crochet work 2 single_crochet along the edge of each of the 10 double_crochet row work one single_crochet into the bottom single_crochet row r1 for a total of 21 single_crochet gathering 2nd side of mesh section place markers and work same as for first mesh section skipping the few chs of the first partial loop they will simply loop inward bordering the 2nd top portion beginning with the single_crochet row r1 of top work 1 single_crochet in r1 and 2 single_crochet along the edge of each the next 10 row for a total of 21 single_crochet © marsha glassner 2018 creating the 2nd handle work same as first handle bordering other side of 2nd top portion single_crochet into 1st double_crochet on the opposite side of the same top section counting this single_crochet as the first single_crochet work 2 single_crochet along the edge of each the 10 row of double_crochet single_crochet into side of single_crochet row r1 for a total of 21 single_crochet skip the few chs of the first partial loop and join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet of r1 you will be joining into the stitch where the hook is shown in photo 11 the skipped chs will simply loop inward r2 chain 3 and double_crochet in each single_crochet and chain around sides and handles join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet r3 chain 3 double_crochet in next double_crochet and in each double_crochet around sdes and handles join with slip_stitch to first double_crochet r4 repeat r3 measure width of handles against cord add additional row if needed to snugly cover cord r5 chain 1 single_crochet in same double_crochet and into each double_crochet in r4 join with slip_stitch to first single_crochet fasten_off inserting the cord if your cord is twisty or has kiks in it you may find it easier to sew in if you hang it for a day or two with a weight suspended from the bottom if combining lengths shorter than 6 sew them together securely wait until the cord is mostly sewn in before sewing together the final two ends lay the cord over one side of the top of the bag leaving a few inches free at the beginning using the same or matching thread and a large-eye or tapestry needle sew the entire length of the handles/sides over the cord when you have about 6 more left to sew closed trim the cord if needed then sew both ends of cord firmly together and finish sewing closed tips 1 check the cord every couple of inches to make sure
